channel.title: tutorial on Embedded Systems Design
channel.description: Recent content in tutorial on Embedded Systems Design

item.title: All About Serial
item.description: What are serial protocols? I2C, SPI, and UART are three of the most common protocols for serial data transmission.

item.title: Creating a custom library in Cadence
item.description: In order to use schematic symbols imported from the web or custom created for your project (very common), you must create a custom symbol library in which to save them.

item.title: Exporting Gerber files from Cadence PCB Editor
item.description: What is a Gerber file? A Gerber file (also known as artwork) is a 2-D graphical representation of a single layer of a PCB.

item.title: Getting Started with Cadence
item.description: Introduction A number of basic Cadence tutorial videos are available on YouTube.

item.title: How to export a PDF from Capture and PCB Editor
item.description: Introduction This tutorial goes through how to save CIS schematics and PCB layers as a PDF.

item.title: Particle Argon Wifi Board
item.description: What is the Particle Argon? What does it do? The Particle Argon is a “wi-fi for everything” development kit that includes a microcontroller, wi-fi hardware, and easy-to-use web-based IDE (Integrated Development Environment).

item.title: Software design
item.description: What is a finite state machine? A finite state machine (FSM) is a way of modeling a system such that there are a limited number of finite “states” that a system can be in, and that it can only be in one of those states at a time.

item.title: Soldering and Desoldering Tips and Tricks
item.description: Video Walkthrough How do I turn on the soldering irons in PRLTA 103?
